head.supplied: [Mr Ramel, in announcing that our two honorary members Messrs. Wilson and Mueller have just been appointed president and vice-president of the Acclimatisation Society of Melbourne, ¶ At a meeting on 7...

div.p:
Letter not found. The text given here is from Bulletin de la Société Impériale Zoologique d'Acclimatation , vol. 8, (1861), p. 611. It is dated to October as the last likely date that a letter could have been sent that would allow Ramel to report it to the meeting of the Society held on 6 December.
[M. Ramel, en faisant connaître que nos deux membres honoraires MM. Wilson et Mueller viennent d'être nommés président et vice-président de la Société d'acclimatation de Melbourne, informe la Société des efforts que fait M. Mueller pour arriver à nourrir le Phascolarctos avec des feuilles sèches d'Eucalyptus, seul moyen qui puisse lui permettre de faire parvenir ce précieux animal. M. Mueller donne également tous ses soins pour trouver un moyen qui lui permette de nous faire parvenir vivant l'Ornithorhynque.]

p.seg: [Mr Ramel, in announcing that our two honorary members Messrs. Wilson and Mueller have just been appointed president and vice-president of the Acclimatisation Society of Melbourne,

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: At a meeting on 7 August to adopt formal rules to govern the Acclimatisation Society of Victoria, it was agreed that the Council should appoint the various officers within one month (Argus , 8 August 1861, p. 5).

p.seg: informs the Society of Mr. Mueller's efforts to feed the Phascolarctos with dry Eucalyptus leaves to allow him to send this precious animal.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: In 1864 M again tried to find a diet to keep Koalas alive during shipment to Europe; see M to R. Owen, 25 September 1864.

p.seg: M. Mueller also gives all his efforts to finding a way to enable him to send us living Ornithorhynchus.]
